DataElement.preferredName: Central Venous Access Catheter Medical Device French Size Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a measurement of size in French standard related to the French catheter gauge,  the outer diameter of a catheter,  a tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs, where each integer represents 1/3 of a millimeter.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Central Venous Access Catheter Medical Device French Catheter Gauge Dimension
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the French catheter gauge,  the outer diameter of a catheter,  a tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs, where each integer represents 1/3 of a millimeter.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs. It also can be used to obtain blood samples. This device avoids the need for separate needle insertions for each infusion or blood test. Examples of these devices include Hickman catheters, which require clamps to make sure the valve is closed, and Groshong catheters, which have a valve that opens as fluid is withdrawn or infused and remains closed when not in use.:Medical device - any machinery designed to aid diagnostic and medical therapies. Medical device has to be designed with rigorous safety standards. There are several basic types of medical devices: life support equipment used to maintain a patient's body functions; therapeutic equipment; monitors and detectors to measure the indexes of a patient's state; imagine machines and laboratory equipment used with diagnostic and status monitoring purposes. In insurance parlance, the term is usually synonymous with assistive device, although it may include medical supplies.

Concepts.definition: A venous catheter positioned with the tip in the proximal third of the superior vena cava, the right atrium, or the inferior vena cava.
Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number representing the outer diameter of a catheter where each integer represents 1/3 of a millimeter.:Dimension; the magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

Concepts.definition: A number representing the outer diameter of a catheter where each integer represents 1/3 of a millimeter.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
